page.title: 06CUSTOMS.
page.content: At home we have a cider shed with an apple crusher and a cider press. Last year we made cider and perry. The Smiths helped us make it. First we picked the apples and then carted them down to the shed. We crushed them to a pulp and made a "cheese" with layers of straw and apple pulp. We left the cider to ferment for three to five weeks, when it was ready to drink. We usually add sugar. {By Rosie Darch At school we carry on the tradition of maypole dancing and Mayfayres.We also danced at Halsway Manor and Fyne Court.We are going to Shepton Mallet soon.At our Mayfayre we had clog dancers.At school we have another custom,ringing the school bell.It is rung every morning at 9.00am before assembly. By Jane White.
